How to Install duply on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • duply

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install duply on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing duply on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall duply in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install duply, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install duply Using apt

To install duply in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install duply using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install duply

The installation of duply might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install duply Using apt-get

To install duply using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install duply.

sudo apt-get -y install duply

Install duply Using Synaptic

To install duply using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install duply on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for duply. This will display the duply package in the package window, now to install duply, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the duply package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of duply.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install duply Using aptitude

To install duply on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of duply.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install duply using the command aptitude install duply.

sudo aptitude -y install duply

How to Upgrade duply on debian

If you want to upgrade the duply package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade duply using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade duply to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade duply.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade duply sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade duply

Upgrade duply using Aptitude

To upgrade duply using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade duply.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade duply

Upgrade duply using Synaptic

To upgrade duply using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for duply, now right-click duply, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade duply just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall duply on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall duply from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just duply, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove duply

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of duply

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of duply you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge duply

Remove duply using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall duply using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for duply, right-click the duply package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall duply click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install duply on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade duply using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.
